intro: Chromolaena phyllocephala, commonly known as the broadleaf chromolaena, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antimalarial properties. The species is also known for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats, making it a common weed in agricultural areas.
